Posted By: Dragasm (4/25/2013 2:19:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So, most of the X cost spells of this block have been rare, yet this was uncommon, as it's not that exploitable, apparently. APPARENTLY.  
  
Rainbow ramp decks will now proceed to not just kill one player, but every player. My friend runs such a deck using lots of mana-ramping defenders like [Overgrown Battlement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overgrown Battlement) and that one from Return To Ravnica, and has already shot me to pieces with Mind Grind.  
  
If you have the means to ramp up to 14 mana with the right colours you'll annihilate most of your opponents. Doran colour decks are going to worry me in particular. Plus, even if you don't kill everyone there's still the TONNES of life you'll have to allow you to take a few punches before your next turn.

posts.post_content:
[Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) was waiting for an X-Drop card in his colors to just blow people up. The previous Orzhov X-drop this set just reanimated stuff and it was dependent on things being in your graveyard anyway, so it didn't really sync with him.
  
   
You guys have no idea how much I want this to happen:
  
   
T4: Crypt Ghast
  
T5: Tesya, Envoy of Ghosts
  
T6: Debt to the Deathless for X = 5 or 6

Posted By: SRSFACE (4/30/2013 6:22:07 PM)

posts.post_content: This card is a win condition. If you get to this bomb, it's like seeing a sphinx's revelation go off. Only the game is actually over without concession. It's living the dream but when an opponent drops [Zhur-Taa Ancient](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhur-Taa Ancient) you are most likely at around a 12-16 point life swing on this card. And that's in set. Makes that 7/5 beater all the more risky with this at uncommon.
posts.html:
